programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Uganda
programme.desc: Set in the heart of Uganda, two unlikely friends from opposite sides of the world unite over their shared love of Chuck Norris and gonzo 80’s action flicks. With sheer determination and an outrageous sense of humor, they team up to create their own explosive movies, catapulting Wakaliwood to international stardom and bringing laughter and joy to millions. Directed by Cathryne Czubek.

programme.title: Chicken Stories
programme.desc: A group of friends use Siri to guide them as they band together to start a farm, in a short documentary by Jonathan Pickett.

programme.title: ifine
programme.desc: Set in Sierra Leone’s Kono district, ifine is a documentary that explores the beauty of Blackness through the eyes of youth coming of age amid a skin bleaching epidemic. Directed by Ebony Gilbert and - Adisa Septuri.

programme.title: Lazarus
programme.desc: Lazarus is a short documentary following Lazarus Chigwandali, a street musician with Albinism from Malawi as he teams up with a London-based music producer to record his debut album. Directed by David Darg.

programme.title: Haiti On Fire
programme.desc: Haiti on Fire chronicles Haiti’s descent into violence and chaos, documenting the rise of Barbecue and the G9 gang alliance.

programme.title: Searching For Satoshi: The Mysterious Disappearance of The Bitcoin Creator
programme.desc: A worldwide investigation into the bizarre vanishing of Bitcoin’s billionaire creator, the secretive “Satoshi."

programme.title: Caffeinated
programme.desc: Learn the story behind your morning Joe. From seed to mug, coffee, and the process by which it is created, has shaped the lives of thousands of individuals worldwide. Caffeinated gives the coffee consumer unprecedented access to the farmers responsible for growing that perfect bean, and the roasters and baristas responsible for brewing that perfect cup. Directed by Vishal Solanki.

programme.title: We Could Be King
programme.desc: True story of two rival high school football teams forced to merge into one and their struggle to become champions against all odds. An unflinching snapshot of the power of sports to bring young people, neighborhoods, and a city together. Directed by Judd Ehrlich.

programme.title: Knuckleball
programme.desc: A documentary that showcases baseball's most unpredictable pitch - follow the journey of the last professional knuckleball pitchers. Tim Wakefield, a 17-year Red Sox veteran, and Mets up-and-comer R.A. Dickey, with just four other living knuckleballers, shine a light on their remarkable brotherhood and the shared pursuit of honor and craftsmanship. Directed by Annie Sundberg.

programme.title: A Swim Lesson
programme.desc: A SWIM LESSON is an ode to an everyday hero: Bill Marsh, a swim teacher who helps children manage their fears and discover their own power when submerged in an overwhelming unknown.

programme.title: The Hobby
programme.desc: A McDonald’s Happy Meal shortage. A security guard escort. Guns pulled in a Target parking lot. All of these are caused by a common factor: trading cards. In 2020, a new BOOM began. For the first time, large hedge funds, celebrities like Logan Paul and Steve Aoki, nostalgic millennials, entrepreneurs like Josh Luber, and billionaires scrambled to add sports, Pokémon, and other hot item cards to their collections and portfolios. Over the next two years, the hobby exploded — even causing card grading services to shut down due to overwhelming customer service. This documentary is a character-driven feel good deep dive into the high-stakes, eccentric world of card collecting, following buyers, sellers, card shop owners, graders, online streamers, auctioneers, and more, who all participate in the hobby in their own unique ways. Directed by Morgan Jon Fox.

programme.title: Lewis Hamilton: The Winning Formula
programme.desc: As the only black Formula One driver in history, Lewis' journey to becoming the most decorated Formula One driver in history, is one of dreams, courage, and determination. Directed by Piers Garland.

programme.title: Kobe Bryant: A Tribute
programme.desc: The sudden and tragic passing of Kobe Bryant, alongside his young daughter Gianna left the world in a stunned silence. Never before has a sporting star held such high esteem outside of their profession… But Kobe Bryant was a superstar. Unmatched on the basketball court and cherished on the red carpet– Kobe’s dedication to his career, his family and his charity work led to him being adored the world over. Directed by Danielle Winter.

programme.title: Five Stone Of Lead
programme.desc: On the west coast of Ireland kids don’t dream about winning the world cup, they dream about being championship jockeys. This is the story of a 12 year old jockey, Dylan, who is tiny even for a jockey. Directed by Jonny Madderson and Jono Stevens.

programme.title: Kid Yamaka
programme.desc: This deeply human story explores boxer Zachary "Kid Yamaka” Wohlman’s difficult past, his training under world-class coach Freddie Roach, and his path to personal redemption through boxing, Judaism, and sobriety. With Zachary’s 2021 passing, this film serves as a moving tribute to his hustle, heart and soul and to all those who struggle with addiction. Directed by Matt Ogens.

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Bill Fong is passionate about bowling. One seeming ordinary night all may change for this underdog as Fong begins to get strike after strike, nearing the ever elusive 'perfect series.' Directed by Joey Daoud.

programme.title: Five Star
programme.desc: With 41 full-ride Division 1 scholarship offers, Brandon Jones is one of the most heavily recruited high school football players in the country. Directed by Ryan Booth.

programme.title: We Are Oscar Mike
programme.desc: Through his non-profit foundation, Oscar Mike, Noah helps rehabilitate other veterans through the adaptive sports that saved his own life. Directed by Nick Cavalier.

programme.title: Osama & Ayman
programme.desc: Osama and Ayman Abdeldayem skate through the streets of our nation's capital, while navigating growing Islamophobia with style and humor. Directed by Ben Mullinkosson, Sam Price-Waldman, and Chris Cresci.

programme.title: NZINGHA
programme.desc: Nzingha Prescod is the #2 ranked women's foil fencer in the United States. In 2015, Nzingha became the first African-American woman to win an individual medal at the Senior World Championships. Should she medal individually in Rio at the 2016 Summer Olympics, she will be the first African-American woman to do so in the history of the sport. Directed by Anderson Wright.

programme.title: The Search for General Tso
programme.desc: This mouthwateringly entertaining documentary traces the surprising origins of the iconic Chinese-American dish, from Shanghai to Middle America and beyond.

programme.title: Caffeinated
programme.desc: Learn the story behind your morning Joe. From seed to mug, coffee, and the process by which it is created, has shaped the lives of thousands of individuals worldwide. Caffeinated gives the coffee consumer unprecedented access to the farmers responsible for growing that perfect bean, and the roasters and baristas responsible for brewing that perfect cup. Directed by Vishal Solanki.

programme.title: Abundance
programme.desc: During the largest food crisis in a century, a group of college students catalyze a national movement to end food insecurity in the U.S. Directed by Owen Dubeck.

programme.title: Wildfire
programme.desc: Nicola is a natural winemaker living in a remote village near Crotone, where his atavistic pursuit of wine is under active siege from climate related wildfires and the prolonged dry seasons. - For Nicola, and other winemakers like him, this environmental change has existential consequences; it threatens his livelihood. “Wildfire” patiently observes Nicola in this affective state of anxiety—as the wildfire grows within him—as he’s forced to alter the course of his harvest in real time. Directed by Andree Ljutica.

programme.title: Blood, Sweat and Beer
programme.desc: Blood, Sweat, and Beer follows a trio of 23-year-olds as they struggle to start The Brew Gentlemen Beer Co. in Braddock, PA., a once-prosperous steel town hoping to bounce back from decades of neglect, violence, and population loss. The film also follows Danny Robinson, a boardwalk brewery owner whose business is threatened by an aggressive trademark lawsuit that could leave him bankrupt. Directed by Chip Hiden and Alexis Irvin.

programme.title: Future Forward - Future Of Farming
programme.desc: Climate change brings unprecedented heavy rains that take inches off topsoil, destroying farmers’ harvests and threatening their livelihoods. Learn how midwestern farming advocacy group, Practical Farmers of Iowa, worked with consumer goods company, Unilever, to tackle this issue head on. Directed by Laura Checkoway.

programme.title: Pickle Man
programme.desc: Facing certain death by ALS, Arthur Cohen decides to leave a legacy of pickles. PickALS, that is. Arthur is brilliant, hilarious and courageous in this intimate portrait of a man facing a brutal disease. Directed by Nastasya Popov.

programme.title: Bloody Nose, Empty Pockets
programme.desc: On the eve of the 2016 U.S. presidential election, and on its final night before closing, a Las Vegas dive bar becomes a stage where its employees and barflies commiserate one last time. Directed by filmmaking brothers Bill and Turner Ross.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 1
programme.desc: Gordon arrives at the notorious HM Prison Brixton, in the hopes of taking non working prisoners and molding them into working cooks. Can Ramsay deal with offenders from murders to a man who was found with a shotgun under his bed?

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 2
programme.desc: As Gordon's business gets busier, the prison's stringent systems and routines start getting to him, and he struggles to keep his brigade together. Serial offender Lawrence loses it in the kitchen and tries to attack another prisoner, and the authorities stop Jerome from being able to bake.

programme.title: Gordon Behind Bars: Episode 3
programme.desc: After two months of success, Gordon now wants to expand the prisoner's food selections and go commercial. Meanwhile the team has dwindled down yet again.
